string-array.name: as_q1
string-array.item: Which of the three sub-atomic particles is the lightest?
Neutrino, The neutron, The proton, The electron
Atomic structure
Sure, neutrino is the lightest one of these subatomic particles

string-array.name: as_q2
string-array.item: Which of the following statements is/are correct? (a) Protons have a charge of -1. (b) Neutrons have no charge. (c) An electron has negligible mass compared to the mass of a neutron.
Statements (b) and (c), Statements (a) and (c), Statement (c) only, Statement (c) only
Atomic structure
Protons have a charge of +1, Neutrons have no charge, the mass of electron is negligible compared to the mass of proton and neutron

string-array.name: as_q3
string-array.item: Which of the following pairs of properties is correct for the proton?

Its got a charge of +1 and normally found inside the nucleus., Its got no charge and normally found inside the nucleus., Its got a charge of -1 and normally found inside the nucleus of an atom., Its got a charge of +1 and normally found outside the nucleus.
Atomic structure
By definition, proton is a positively charged particle found inside of the nucleus if one could look inside of it.

string-array.name: as_q4
string-array.item: Which of the following statements is false?

An element consists of more than one type of atom, There are more than 100 different types of elements known, An atom is the smallest part of an element that can exist on its own., Not all elements can be found naturally on earth.
Atomic structure
An element consists of one type of atoms. The other statements are true.

string-array.name: as_q5
string-array.item: Which one of the elements shown in the periodic table below has a full outer shell of electrons??

An element consists of more than one type of atom, There are more than 100 different types of elements known, An atom is the smallest part of an element that can exist on its own., Not all elements can be found naturally on earth.
Atomic structure
Neon is a noble gas which has its outer shell completely filled.
